title: "If we win early game, enemy team shouldn't be allowed to turtle and turn it around"
body:
How dare people resist my team, stalling to close the game.

How dare people not surrender when you snowball.

How dare people persevere despite the odds.

How dare people try and win against you. 

How dare people make a come back. 

How dare people cs under tower. 

How dare people use strategy.

How dare people win. 

http://i.imgur.com/5Lhh4t9.jpg

replies.body: You know what really grinds my gears? When people choose a late game carry like Vayne or Draven, but then want to FF at 20 because an early game bully like Pantheon has more kills then them.

{{champion:67}} OMFG!! FF at 20!!!
{{champion:75}} They sent a zed up here, don't ruin this for me.

> [{quoted}](name=Knoyle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7OjXkXc,comment-id=00020003,timestamp=2016-02-02T18:28:27.518+0000)
>
> {{champion:67}} OMFG!! FF at 20!!!
> {{champion:75}} They sent a zed up here, don't ruin this for me.

Oh god, I died.
It's odd how you tend to get toplane late-gamers who're a lot more calm than the bot-lane late-gamers.

> [{quoted}](name=charcharmunro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7OjXkXc,comment-id=0002000300000000,timestamp=2016-02-02T22:23:52.495+0000)
>
> It's odd how you tend to get toplane late-gamers who're a lot more calm than the bot-lane late-gamers.

I think that's because late game top laners tend to actually be late game oriented with weak early games, while ADCs are used to having "late game" champions like Vayne where solo killing your enemy ADC at 8 minutes from 0/0/0 with just a Cutlass can happen. People who play hypercarry ADCs expect both to 1v5 late game and get insanely fed early game.
Used to be different when Kog was around but now....
Kog mains are peaceful creatures.

Just a few games back a mastery 5 Kog told me "I hope you family dies in a fire" because I accidentally stepped too far from my lantern when trying to save him :^)

Not sure if Kog main but seemed like a good place to put this.
Sounds like a Vayne/Riven main trying out Kog

Oh dog! I died.
- Zed probably

It generally irritates me when people pick lategame hypercarries because for the first few minutes they tend to act like they already hit the lategame. So as a support I spend all my mana pulling them out of the fire repeatedly.
https://media.giphy.com/media/nrMFyzURaesuY/giphy.gif
Where's the gif m8?

Gears too ground to find a good gif. People FF because of early game bullies is pretty much the only thing that can make me rage in game. So this is the best I got:
http://i.imgur.com/B5PXxhy.gif?noredirect
This is Gameplay, not M&G.
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/783/263/4a3.gif
I regret nothing.
https://49.media.tumblr.com/6c1f1aaa5fce6d58e72325f1c2d0d17a/tumblr_o132e1Khin1v2gp2qo1_500.gif

let me help you with that :p

http://img.pandawhale.com/59283-Anchorman-downvote-gif-dKAm.gif

I can go anywhere I damn well please.
http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/ofibty/images/0/03/Bitch-get-out-of-my-face.gif/revision/latest?cb=20130330190647
Kinda like a cancer. ;p
https://31.media.tumblr.com/95d11262d137549697b31ec19f74fc7a/tumblr_mtrwtmW3Sx1rqp2rqo1_500.gif
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

the statement is a gif, just w/o pictures :D

 http://tse1.mm.bing.net/th?&id=OIP.M296df31e2517169db761c150a796b87co0&w=232&h=179&c=0&pid=1.9&rs=0&p=0

It doesn't get better in Silver or Gold, and sometimes it's still the same shit in Platinum. There's always one whiny bastard who wants to surrender no matter what. That last example I can think of was a D5 Vayne player doing that in a Plat ranked game... while we were 6 towers, 3 dragons, and 10 kills up.

**A word of advice:**
-----


_**Enemy Vayne**_

* smart
* loyal
* respected
---

_**Your Vayne**_

* stupid
* salty
* reported
---

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}
Shaco law in action.
It basiclaly applies to Vayne, Shaco, Rengar and then every FotM

> [{quoted}](name=Neo Cyrus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7OjXkXc,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2016-02-02T18:22:05.158+0000)
>
> It doesn't get better in Silver or Gold, and sometimes it's still the same shit in Platinum. There's always one whiny bastard who wants to surrender no matter what. That last example I can think of was a D5 Vayne player doing that in a Plat ranked game... while we were 6 towers, 3 dragons, and 10 kills up.

{{champion:67}} main syndrome transcends all elos? I believe you.
draven isn't a late game carry ...
Draven carries all game long

He is when he makes their ADC disappear from the map with 2 auto attacks late game because he is 2 items up and 4 levels since he obliterated them early game to the point of no return. Unlike Pantheon or any other champ that is considered "only good early game" Draven's damage doesn't fall off late game and it is usually his lack of mobility that bites him in the ass in a 35 minute game since he can get caught out easily. I mean who WOULDN'T want a piece of Draaaaaaaaaven?

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7OjXkXc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-02T17:49:14.256+0000)
>
> You know what really grinds my gears? When people choose a late game carry like Vayne or Draven, but then want to FF at 20 because an early game bully like Pantheon has more kills then them.

I once saw a rank 5 Singed go 0-2 in lane at 15 minutes and start spamming about how it was gg and we should surrender.

http://33.media.tumblr.com/e3f74a78986481f2dad32f6390d9b63b/tumblr_mgou9zNKJ51qkbwrdo1_1280.gif

He wasn't a good Singed player then. There are 3 types of Singed players.

One that goes 2/3/6 and loses the game or gets carried because Singed is not good at team fighting.

The one that goes 2/10/0 and loses because he is a straight feeder.

And finally the one that goes 2/10/0 and single handedly carries the game by being the most obnoxious split pusher known to man and forces multiple people to stop his shananigans while the rest of his team does actual productive things such as engage on the now 4v3.

I just kinda accept that a Pantheon will kick my ass early-game (I usually play {{champion:27}}) and then suddenly he doesn't kick my ass any more after I, y'know, farm and just grab literally any armor.
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/053/259/ebd.jpg

Season 6 be like...

https://45.media.tumblr.com/3d9a8f79f347a9c753314b6f18de0983/tumblr_najtaa2SZl1s3ewmvo1_500.gif

How Riot sees current League vs how players see it:

https://youtu.be/WUhOnX8qt3I?t=45s
Not sure this was intentional or not, but the structure of the post was sweet, the way each line got shorter
Why the hell were you downvoted? Got you back to what I could :)

IMHO, such a thing as a "hyper carry" shouldnt exist at all. Its bad game design. Why reward someone who completely lost (for whatever reason) and make him/her able to duke it out with half the enemy team solo after a certain amount of time, dispite his bad game? All the while other champions on the same role cant do that. Making a comeback with team tactics and plays is entirely a great consept but, making a comeback because your x hyper carry managed to build its necessary items despite most of the game failing? I dont agree to that, I consider it to be the weekest spot of LoL IMHO.

because you didn't completely lost until your nexus got destroyed.
and if the enemy fails to win when 10k gold ahead, then its their fault for not being able to close the game out until the hyper carry got his or her items
If you have the Early Advantage, and fail to capitalize on it... you deserve to lose.

Man, saying someone "doesn't deserve to win" just because they did some shit like that is probably the stupidest thing someone can say. Other day I saw someone whining about how the enemies basically mutilated them after the game dragged on for a particularly long time and that IT should never happen. Just because you as a player drill the enemies into the ground, it doesn't mean they don't have a chance of winning. One experience I had of this was off of the mistakes the enemies made for dragging on the game for too long after i fed as Darius top hard which then later allowed me to become immortal in team fights. It's mostly one team's fault for letting this happen and it's shitty when I see people complain about this.

Excellent post my friend.
I disagree, I had games where I shouldn't and didn't deserve to win and was just carried by my teammates.

Something really important in games is letting yourself be carried which a lot of people don't get. When I'm LeBlanc and I'm 0/3, it's clear I won't help out. So I sit back and lose a lot of farm but I don't let them kill me. I'll split push and maybe catch someone out by hiding in a bush. I'm not fed, i can't really even 1v1 anyone except maybe the support, but since I didn't feed my team can pull my weight for me. 

Can't win lane every time~
I miss when dragon was just gold and didn't determine the game.

I had a really painful game like this where I was playing Karma sup and was snowballing bot and mid but top and jg were losing . Midgame we were up like 7 kills 2 drags and 2 towers but they just stomped us because we couldn't team fight for shit. Dang thats what we get for having no hard cc I guess.

> [{quoted}](name=Xicashina,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7OjXkXc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-02-02T17:15:35.187+0000)
>
> I had a really painful game like this where I was playing Karma sup and was snowballing bot and mid but top and jg were losing . Midgame we were up like 7 kills 2 drags and 2 towers but they just stomped us because we couldn't team fight for shit. Dang thats what we get for having no hard cc I guess.

- Picked Karma

- Doesn't realize why no one picks Karma support

- Loses from lack of hard cc

And this is why no one uses Karma support. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
She has better hard CC than Soraka
